timeline.subject: Catherine femme Jean Bertremin
timeline.details: Taken by prevot following accusation by Françatte femme Claudon Jardel

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Jean Bertremin
timeline.details: Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Jean Bertremin
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews and rack for 2 hours; continued to deny charges stoutly, insisting she was good Christian

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Jean Bertremin
timeline.details: Rémy suggests she be renvoyée; Change de Nancy approves

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Jean Bertremin
timeline.details: Prévôt records she has been released

harms_catalog.victim_name: oxen of Jean Claudel Estienne
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell sick after she looked at them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Unpaid debt for grain; had to sue her, taking manure in payment

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Jean Claudel Estienne
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost her milk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: came to house asking for fire

harms_catalog.victim_name: sheep of Jean Claude Didier
ox of Jean Claude Didier
ox of Jean Claude Didier's father
harms_catalog.harm_description: began to limp, one quarter rotten; had been bewitched
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: father's animals strayed into her meadow; she cursed them

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Bastien Jeandon
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost her milk suddenly for a week; then became very ill from Christmas until St James
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine came to ask for 'prendant' to make cheese

harms_catalog.victim_name: Bastien Jeandon
harms_catalog.harm_description: large branch broke while in cherry tree; fell out; in bed 8 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: said something about her being witch to wife

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Colas Vincent Valdezey
harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly changed color in cradle and became as if dead; died in 3 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: cow got into her garden; she cursed it and all household

harms_catalog.victim_name: young bull of Colas Vincent Valdezey
harms_catalog.harm_description: fine young bull sickened; could not draw blood; died in a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: evicted from house; she said they would repent

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox of Colas Vincent Valdezey
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill and would not eat; recovered after Catherine said it would
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: father angry at witness for working beasts too long; she angry and said devil should thank them

harms_catalog.victim_name: grandchild of Vincent Valdezey
fine bull of Colin Claudel Colin
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost suddenly
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: took part of bouquet from his daughter in churchyard

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Claudon Claude Didier
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill after Catherine visited; seemed she would lose her mind

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox of Claudon Claude Didier's father
harms_catalog.harm_description: was eating new hedge which her husband planted before it sickened

harms_catalog.victim_name: pig of Claudon Claude Didier
fine bull of Claudon Claude Didier
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost after she said 'Le diable soit au chastel, qu'il estoit bien hault mais qu'il rabaisseroit'

harms_catalog.victim_name: 6 children of Colas Didier de la Faigne
harms_catalog.harm_description: of 8 children, only 2 lived; 2 could not even be baptised in church; none of 6 lived to be a year old

harms_catalog.victim_name: Claudel Holbin and wife
harms_catalog.harm_description: both fell ill and were in feeble state for 3 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: stood caution for her husband's debt; sergent came; she threatened witness

harms_catalog.victim_name: baby of Agathe femme Jean Claude Estienne
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost her milk after Catherine came asking for fire; baby died after 2 months

harms_catalog.victim_name: Agathe femme Colas de la Faigne
harms_catalog.harm_description: received mysterious blows to head while alone after birth of first child

harms_catalog.victim_name: first child of Agathe femme Colas de la Faigne
harms_catalog.harm_description: died in two weeks

harms_catalog.victim_name: another child of Agathe femme Colas de la Faigne
harms_catalog.harm_description: emaciated and lost use of limbs

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Jehenne femme Simon Vincent Valdezey
harms_catalog.harm_description: sick child expected to die; recovered after Catherine said to take courage

harms_catalog.victim_name: Simon Colas Simon
harms_catalog.harm_description: swollen leg so painful he thought would go mad; recovered in 3-4 days after confronting her

harms_catalog.victim_name: fine cow of Colas George Goery
harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly became ill, throwing legs about and bellowing; milk lost for that year
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: she went to reap for him and wished him to devil

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox of Colas Claudon Petit Jean Louys
harms_catalog.harm_description: bad leg; could hardly walk; suddenly recovered after Catherine said it was nothing
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wife or servant chased her sow from garden with stick; she threatened him

harms_catalog.victim_name: calf of Colas Claudon Petit Jean Louys
harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly lost use of legs

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Claude Didier (witness 2)
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle vivoit quelque temps qu'elle l'en feroit repentir
notable_quotes.english: if she lived some time she would make him repent
notable_quotes.context: Threat after being evicted and accused of theft

notable_quotes.speaker: Vincent Valdezey (witness 10)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'avoit que faire de souhaister a personne mal que c'estoit une genaxe et n'avoit trop bon bruict
notable_quotes.english: she had no business wishing harm to anyone, that she was a troublemaker and did not have a good reputation
notable_quotes.context: Telling her off after she cursed cow and household

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Claude Didier (witness 14)
notable_quotes.french: Le diable soit au chastel, qu'il estoit bien hault mais qu'il rabaisseroit
notable_quotes.english: The devil be in the castle, that it was very high but it would be brought low
notable_quotes.context: Catherine's words after quarrel about straying animals

notable_quotes.speaker: Simon Colas Simon (witness 53)
notable_quotes.french: Entende Catherine tu es une genoxe il m'est venu un mal en une jambe, je crois que tu en es cause, sy elle ne se guarit je te feray brusler
notable_quotes.english: Listen Catherine you are a troublemaker, I have a pain in my leg, I believe you are the cause, if it does not heal I will have you burned
notable_quotes.context: Confronting Catherine about his swollen leg

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Jean Bertremin
notable_quotes.english: that he should have patience and it would heal
notable_quotes.context: Response to Simon Colas Simon's threat

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudel Holbin (witness 27)
notable_quotes.french: se demenoit fort, et ne fut sy discrette de s'abstenir de parler qu'elle ne dise a luy deposant qu'il s'en repentiroit
notable_quotes.english: carried on greatly, and was not discreet enough to refrain from speaking that she said to him that he would repent of it
notable_quotes.context: When sergent came for payment on debt

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over debt (grain unpaid, standing caution for husband's debt), property (evicted from rented house for stealing peas), theft (flax, peas), and poverty indicators (economic value of animals repeatedly mentioned suggesting importance of livestock)

material_culture.context: Jean Claudel Estienne sold her grain as tutor; debt dispute
asked for some to make cheese
from three great days of the year; used as remedy
Catherine brought to sick wife; cure
put out to dry; Catherine stole some
stored in house; Catherine caught stealing
brought by Catherine to sick wife
brought by Catherine to sick wife
fed to baby before it died
given to baby after mother lost milk
Catherine said she went to fetch saw for planks
Catherine said she went to fetch bread
Catherine came asking for fire during childbed

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial resulted in release after torture. Catherine maintained her innocence throughout interrogation and torture (thumbscrews and rack for 2 hours). Many witnesses testified to general reputation and specific harms, particularly involving animals and children's deaths/illnesses. Notable pattern of Catherine apparently curing illnesses she was accused of causing. Economic hardship and debt disputes prominent throughout.
